title: Phoebe Waller-Bridge looks chic as she wins British Artist of the Year at Britannia Awards
text:
Her hit shows Fleabag and Killing Eve have dominated the award ceremonies over the past few months.

And Phoebe Waller-Bridge had yet another accolade to add to her impressive collection after she took home the British Artist of the Year gong at BAFTA's Britannia Awards on Friday night in Los Angeles.

The award-winning star, 34, looked effortlessly chic as she posed with glamorous actress Kerry Washington inside the The Beverly Hilton hotel.

What a woman: Phoebe Waller-Bridge had yet another accolade to add to her impressive collection after she took home the British Artist of the Year gong at BAFTA's Britannia Awards on Friday night in Los Angeles

Phoebe showcased her svelte frame in a black asymmetrical jumpsuit with satin trousers and a sequin embroidered top with ruffled chiffon detailing on the shoulders.

The Fleabag actress added height to her frame with a pair of black heels, she styled her signature cropped brunette locks into a tousled hairdo and added a slick of make-up, which included a pink lipstick.

Meanwhile Kerry, 42, looked sensational in a jewel and pearl encrusted mini dress with a square neckline and cut-out detailing.

The Scandal star styled her brunette locks into a sleek straightened hairdo, she added a slick of gorgeous make-up which included a deep plum coloured lipstick.

Leading ladies: The award-winning star, 34, looked effortlessly chic as she posed with glamorous actress Kerry Washington inside the The Beverly Hilton hotel

Work it: Phoebe showcased her svelte frame in a black asymmetrical jumpsuit with satin trousers and a sequin embroidered top with ruffled chiffon detailing on the shoulders

Talented: She styled her signature cropped brunette locks into a tousled hairdo and added a slick of make-up, which included a pink lipstick

Phoebe was awarded the British Artist of the Year gong at the Britannia Awards, which is presented by BAFTA Los Angeles and is a branch of the British Academy of Film and Television Arts.

The star reflected on her 'extraordinary year' during her acceptance speech on Friday night, she said: 'This has been the most extraordinary year of my life.'

Phoebe was supported by her boyfriend Martin McDonagh, 49, at the event as they were spotted getting cosy during the bash.

Phoebe wasn't the only British star winning the awards with Alan Partridge star Steve Coogan taking home the Charlie Chaplin Britannia Award for Excellence in Comedy.

Sensational: Meanwhile Kerry, 42, looked sensational in a jewel and pearl encrusted mini dress with a square neckline and cut-out detailing

Smitten: Phoebe was supported by her boyfriend Martin McDonagh, 49, at the event as they were spotted getting cosy during the bash

Fabulous: Phoebe was awarded the British Artist of the Year gong at the Britannia Awards, which is presented by BAFTA Los Angeles and is a branch of the British Academy of Film and Television Arts

Just weeks ago Phoebe's Fleabag scooped six trophies at the Emmy Awards, including the award for Outstanding Comedy Series, while Jodie Comer took home the Lead Actress in a Drama Series for her role in Phoebe's drama Killing Eve.

Following the awards ceremony, the actress and playwright shared: 'Even though it’s so nice to hear that so many people loved it, it’s like: "Oh dammit, maybe I shouldn’t have waved goodbye." But it does feel right to go out on a high.'

Fleabag tells the story of a young woman who is struggling to cope with the loss of her best friend, while dealing with her uptight sister and her father's new partner.

Sweet: The star reflected on her 'extraordinary year' during her acceptance speech on Friday night

Humble: Phoebe said: 'This has been the most extraordinary year of my life.'

Pals: The star was awarded her trophy by The Lion King star Donald Glover as they sweetly hugged on stage

Created by and starring Phoebe, the sitcom dropped its second season on Amazon Prime earlier this year in the US and first aired in the UK on BBC Three.

The show is not to extend beyond the two seasons that have been released, both of which were critically praised, each with a 100 percent rating on Rotten Tomatoes.

Fleabag was based on Phoebe's one-woman routine, which she first performed at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival and resurrected for a limited run in the UK and USA.

Wow: Phoebe recently signed a reported £15 million-a-year deal til 2022 with Amazon Studios, and has revealed she'll work on new projects with the Fleabag team

Wow: She said of her new television gig: 'I'm insanely excited to be continuing my relationship with Amazon. Working with the team on Fleabag was the creative partnership dreams are made of. It really feels like home. I can't wait to get going!' (pictured with Norman Lear, Jackie Chan and Steve Coogan who all won awards too)

Ah-ha! Phoebe wasn't the only British star winning the awards with Alan Partridge star Steve Coogan taking home the Charlie Chaplin Britannia Award for Excellence in Comedy

Since taking to the stage, Phoebe, who was recently called in to offer her expertise for the upcoming Bond film No Time To Die, has seen her play receive a plethora of five-star reviews.

Phoebe has also since signed a reported £15 million-a-year deal til 2022 with Amazon Studios, and has revealed she'll work on new projects with the Fleabag team.

She said of her new television gig: 'I'm insanely excited to be continuing my relationship with Amazon. Working with the team on Fleabag was the creative partnership dreams are made of. It really feels like home. I can't wait to get going!'

Wow: Just weeks ago Phoebe's Fleabag scooped six trophies at the Emmy Awards, including the award for Outstanding Comedy Series, while Jodie Comer took home the Lead Actress in a Drama Series for her role in Phoebe's drama Killing Eve
description: The award-winning star, 34, looked effortlessly chic as she posed with glamorous actress Kerry Washington inside the The Beverly Hilton hotel.
